page.title: 09DONCASTER RACECOURSE
page.content: HORSE RACING SEEMS TO HAVE TAKEN PLACE IN DONCASTER FROM BEFORE 1600 AND BY THE EARLY EIGHTEENTH CENTURY DONCASTER CORPORATION SUPPORTED SOME RACES BY OFFERING PRIZE MONEY.THE MOST FAMOUS RACE RUN AT TOWN MOOR IS{THE ST LEGER} WHICH WAS FIRST RUN IN 1776 AND NOW FORMS THE SHOWPIECE RACE OF THE ANNUAL SEPTEMBER RACE MEETING.SEVERAL OTHER RACE MEETINGS NOW TAKE PLACE EACH YEAR,AND FOR MANY YEARS,WELL INTO THE TWENTIETH CENTURY,THE PEOPLE LIVING CLOSE TO THE RACECOURSE MADE A HANDSOME PROFIT FROM LETTING THEIR HOMES TO RACE-GOERS. MODERN TRAVELLING HAS NOW ALTERED THE PATTERN OF RACE-GOING,YET LARGE CROWDS ARE STILL ATTRACTED TO TOWN MOOR RACECOURSE.THE NEW MODERN RACECOURSE GRANDSTAND BUILT TO ACCOMODATE THESE SPECTATORS IS ALSO USED AS AN EXHIBITION CENTRE AND FOR OTHER ENTERTAINMENTS.
